Choi Jae-bong (Korean: 최재봉, Hanja: 崔財鳳, born 19 June 1980) is a South Korean speed skater. He represented his country at the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano. At that time he was the holder of the junior World record at 1500 m, set in early December 1997 in Thialf, Heerenveen, where he clocked 1:52.25 to break the record. In Nagano where he finished in 12th position he broke his own world junior record to a new best time of 1:51.47, which was 0.78 of a second faster. He also finished in 29th position at the 5000 m. In November 1998 he broke the junior world record over 500 m into a new time of 36.30 in Calgary and a day later he broke his own 1500 m record again, this time 1:49.71 was his new best time. Due to these records and some other decent results in that same weekend he also broke the junior world record for the small allround classification to 153.689 points. That same season he won the bronze medal at the World Junior Allround Championships and broke another two world records. He set 1:10.87 at the 1000 m in February 1999 and a total of 143.965 points for the sprint classification again in Calgary.

As a senior, during his second Olympic Games, the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City he finished 17th at the 500 m, 12th at the 1000 m and 21st at the 1500 m. He also represented South Korea four years later during the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin. In Italy he finished in his all-time best Olympic result, by becoming 8th at the 500 m. He also became 17th at the 1000 m.

7 years after ‘Reply 1988’, Park Bo Gum is now a top actor, while Hyeri has yet to gain a more successful role than Duk Sun.

7 years have passed since the last broadcast of “Reply 1988“, but the drama still remains one of the most loved family and slice-of-life dramas of all time. It was once voted the best drama ever by Korean netizens on Pann. When it was released in 2015, “Reply 1988” recorded a nationwide viewership rating of 18.803% for its last episode, setting a new record for tvN and becoming the 4th highest-rated drama in the history of Korean cable TV.

“Reply 1988” consists of 20 episodes, directed by Shin Won Ho and penned by Lee Woo Jung. The story is intertwined between the present and the past, depicting the youth of a group of 5 close friends (four boys, one girl) and the touching love of 5 families in Ssangmun Dong neighborhood. Realistic footage, relatable dialogues, meaningful messages, and life lessons are what help “Reply 1988” win the hearts of viewers of all ages.

Duk Sun’s family

Sung Dong Il plays the character of the same name, the father and breadwinner of the Sung family. He is a longtime banker, who is grumpy but affectionate. He loves his three children unconditionally. Many of his scenes brought tears to viewers, especially the scene of seeing off his first daughter to get married. Even though the shoes his daughter bought didn’t fit his feet, he still tried to wear them to make her happy.

Sung Dong Il is a veteran Korean actor. He was born in 1964 and has been active in the industry for 33 years. His filmography includes nearly 100 movies and TV series, most notably the “Reply” series (1997, 1994 and 1988), “Lovers in Paris”, “Green Rose”, “Fashion 70s”, “Gap-dong”, “It’s Okay, That’s Love”…

Currently, he is happily married to Park Kyung Hye, a non-celebrity who is 14 years younger than him. The couple has three children, a son and two daughters. He and his two eldest children have a large fan base across Asia thanks to their participation in the reality show “Where Are We Going, Dad?”.

Lee Il Hwa also plays the character of the same name, a housewife. She takes good care of her husband and children. She is also kind to her neighbors and likes to “gossip”. Her styling, image, and way of talking feel realistic and close.

Lee Il Hwa was born in 1971 and made her acting debut in 1991. Like Sung Dong Il, Lee Il Hwa is best known for her role in “Reply 1988”. She also earned much praise for her acting in challenging roles in “Iljimae”, “Prosecutor Princess”, “My Love From The Star”, “She Was pretty”…

She and singer Kang In Won got married in 1996 but divorced a year later. The celebrity couple has a child together. In 2011, she married a university professor and has been keeping her personal life a low profile.

Sung Bo Ra – the first daughter of the Sung family – is played by Ryu Hye Young. She is good at studying. Having an unruly nature, she often fights with her siblings. She is active in the student protest movement. Bo Ra’s love story with her neighbor is loved by many viewers.

Ryu Hye Young was born in 1991 and has been engaged in acting activities since 2007. The launching pad from “Reply 1988” helped her to become more familiar with the audience. However, her following roles could not surpass the success of Sung Bo Ra.

Jeon Mi Seon plays the middle-aged Bo Ra, with a strong, hot-tempered personality. According to many viewers, her natural facial expressions are the most charming.

She was born in 1970 and has been acting since 1986. Her outstanding works include: “Christmas in August”, “The Moon Embracing the Sun”, “School 2015″… Jeon Mi Seon tied the knot with director Park Sang Hoon in 2006 and had a son. On June 29, 2019, the public was in shock when she reportedly committed suicide in the bathroom of a small hotel in Jeonju. Many years before she was found dead, the late artist struggled with loneliness and was treated for depression.

Duk Sun, the second child of the Sung family, is played by Hyeri. She is the only female member in the squad of 5 friends on Ssangmun Dong street. Duk Sun has a generous personality, sometimes naive, quick-witted, and clumsy. She later became a flight attendant, so she fell in love with the genius of Korean Go.

Lee Hyeri, born in 1994, is a member of K-pop girl group Girl’s Day. Thanks to the success of “Reply 1988”, she was ranked 3rd by Forbes magazine among the most powerful Korean artists in 2016. Since then, she has been cast as the lead in several dramas but has not surpassed the success of her role as Duk Sun. She is currently dating Ryu Jun Yeol – co-star in “Reply 1988“.

Lee Mi Yeon was born in 1971, famous in Korea in the 1980s thanks to her beauty and talent. In “Reply 1988”, the scriptwriter installed many interesting details, Korean parents at that time compared their children with Mi Yeon: “A 17-18-year-old kid has become a ‘CF Queen’. You only know how to eat and sleep.” At the age of 24, she married Kim Seung Woo but divorced 5 years later. Currently, Mi Yeon is single, while her ex-husband is happy with the star Kim Nam Joo.

Choi Sung Won plays Sung No Eul – the youngest son of the Sung family. The character looks old, naive but observant. No Eul was the first to suspect, finding out that the sisters were seeing two other boys in the neighborhood. The scenes of him being bullied by two sisters brought laughter to the audience.

Choi Sung Won was born in 1985 and has been acting since 2011. In 2016, the doctor diagnosed him with acute blood cancer, causing him to drop out of the drama “Mirror of the Witch”. Thanks to timely detection and treatment, he gradually recovered and re-appeared in dramas and TV shows such as “Gangnam Beauty”, “Psychopath Diary”…

Jung Hwan’s family

Kim Sung Kyun plays the character of the same name, the breadwinner of the Kim family, who is humorous but sometimes seems like a crazy person in the eyes of his wife. He is many years younger than his wife and always trying to please his life partner. Most of the scenes featuring Kim Sung Kyun are hilarious.

The amusing greeting of the childish uncle Kim Sung Kyun and Duk Sun.

Kim Sung Kyun was born in 1980 and originally a theater actor. He was loved by the audience from the drama “Reply 1994”, and later appeared in many hit works such as “Untouchable”, “Phantom Detective”, “The Prison”, “The Fiery Priest”, etc. and most recently the Netflix action blockbuster “Seoul Vibe” to be available this year. Kim Sung Kyun got married to actress Kim Hye Jung in 2010, and had three children.

Ra Mi Ran played the character of the same name, nicknamed “Madame Cheetah” for her straightforward personality, who often scolds her husband but is kind to her neighbors and sensible to her children. According to Naver, experts say that Ra Mi Ran‘s natural acting makes many Korean and Asian housewives excited.

Born in 1975, Ra Mi Ran is a veteran actress. She started her career in theater but has won many prestigious awards in film and television. Her famous works include “Dancing Queen”, “Ode To My Father”, “Miss & Mrs. Cops”, “The Gentlemen of Wolgyesu Tailor Shop”, “Miracle that We Met”, etc. Recently, she was confirmed to lead TVING’s new drama ‘Cruel Intern’, along with Uhm Ji Won, her co-star in the 2013 movie “Wish”. The actress got married in 2003, and has a son.

Actor Ahn Jae Hong played the role of the eldest son of the Kim family, Kim Jung Bong, who failed the entrance exam 6 times in a row. Despite being not very intelligent, he is emotional, romantic and has a huge love for his brother. Thanks to Jung Bong winning the lottery, the Kim family had a life-changing experience, becoming a rich family in Ssangmun Dong Street.

Ahn Jae Hong was born in 1986 and started acting in 2009. He mainly played supporting roles in the films “One the Beach at the Night Alone”, “Coin Locker Girl”, “Fight for My Way”, “Miss & Mrs. Cops” etc. After breaking up with his girlfriend who is 5 years younger than him last year, he is currently not dating anyone.

The role of Kim Jung Hwan, a smart, emotional guy that is covered under his cold appearance, is played by Ryu Jun Yeol. He had a one-sided love with his best friend for many years but did not have the courage to declare his feelings to her. According to Pann, viewers’ favorite scenes of Jung Hwan are when he covered Duk Sun on the bus, waited for her to go to school together, and deeply regretted when he let Duk Sun go. Later he became a pilot.

Ryu Jun Yeol was born in 1986. When he was a college student, he used to work as a tutor, restaurant server, pizza delivery, etc. In 2012, he started acting but did not achieve anything because of his poor appearance. “Reply 1988” was the stepping stone that helped him get many roles in such movies like: “The King”, “A Taxi Driver”, “Believer”, “Hit and Run Squad” and “Money” etc. His 2021 drama “Lost” where he co-starred actress Jeon Do Yeon achieved great attention for its slow and dark plot, circling around themes such as depression and suicide. According to Daum, he is called “weird but charming” by the audience. His relationship with Girl’s Day’s Hyeri is supported by Asian audiences.

Sun Woo’s family

Actor Kim Sun Young (far right) plays the character of the same name. She is the youngest among the mothers in Ssangmun Dong Street. She came from a poor background, raising two children alone when her husband died. Despite the difficulties, Sun Young is still optimistic. She later remarried to Taek’s father.

Kim Sun Young is a talented actor, born in 1976 with nearly 30 years of experience. She made her mark with good-natured, humorous roles in “Monster”, “Miss Baek”, “Crash Landing on You”… In March, she appeared in “Hospital Playlist“ as a cameo.

Go Kyung Pyo plays Sun Woo, who is described as the “ideal” and “ordinary” boy in the neighborhood. He was filial to his mother, loved his sister, devoted to his friends, and polite to adults. He is the best in his class and determined in love. Sun Woo has a one-sided love with Bo Ra – Duk Sun’s older sister. Many viewers said they were moved by their love story.

He was born in 1990, and has a beautiful body with a height of 1.88 m. Go Kyung Pyo has been acting since 2010, appearing in many dramas such as “All Kinds of Jealousy”, “Chicago Typewriter”, “Cross”… He was discharged from the army in January 2020. In 2022, he will return in “Seoul Vibe”.

Taek’s family

Choi Moo Sung plays the character of the same name – the father of Go genius Choi Taek. His character is a gentle, grumpy man who gives all his love to his children after his wife’s death. The audience was touched by the scenes where he stayed up all night waiting for his son to return, always quietly being with his son when he failed…

Choi Moo Sung was born in 1968, acting since 2002. He has acted in many series such as “A Special Lady”, “Mr. Sunshine”, “Weightlifting Fairy Kim Bok Joo”, “Arthdal Chronicles”, ” Nokdu Flower”…

Park Bo Gum plays the Go genius Choi Taek – considered a “national treasure” of Korea. The character has an illustrious career, won many world gold medals, but is a naive and clumsy boy in everyday life. Taek has special feelings for the female lead Duk Sun but not dare to confess his love because his best friend also loves her.

Park Bo Gum is a sought-after actor in Korea today. He was born in 1993, 1.82 m tall, he is famous for his series of dramas such as “Moonlight Drawn by Clouds”, “I remember you”, “Encounter”, etc. In 2019, he ranked 18th on Forbes Korea’s list of 40 most powerful stars. According to Pann, Bo Gum was rumored to have dated Jang Nara and had an affair with Song Hye Kyo when she was married, but he denied all these rumors.’

The late artist Kim Joo Hyuk plays the role of middle-aged Choi Taek. According to the director, Joo Hyuk plays the character’s naivety and awkwardness well – similar to the young Taek played by Park Bo Gum.

Kim Joo Hyuk was born in 1972, famous for many dramas such as “Hur Jun, the Original Story”, “God of War”, “Lovers in Prague”, etc. He used to date Kim Ji Soo, Kim Guyri and unfinished plans to marry his lover, Lee Yoo Young – after a car accident on the afternoon of October 30, 2017. He passed away at the age of 45.

Dong Ryung’s family

Yoo Jae Myung plays the character of the same name, a strict teacher at school and a humorous “ajjushi” when he returns to Ssangmun Dong Street. The scenes he appeared brought laughter to the audience.

The actor was born in 1973, has played “Angel Eyes”, “Wonderful Wife”, and “Prison Playbook”... Yoo Jae Myung was mentioned with a dense frequency thanks to his role in “Itaewon Class“.

Actor Lee Dong Hwi plays Ryu Dong Ryong, who loves to sing and dance. He caused many funny situations because of his cleverness and curiosity. As an adult, he opened a restaurant.

Lee Dong Hwi was born in 1985, and is appreciated by experts for his good acting. He has acted in blockbuster movies such as “Veteran”, “The Handmaid”, “The Bros”, “Extreme Job”... The actor has been dating “Squid Game” actress – Jung Ho Yeon since 2015.

Choi Jae-bong (Korean: 최재봉, Hanja: 崔財鳳, born 19 June 1980) is a South Korean speed skater. He represented his country at the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano. At that time he was the holder of the junior World record at 1500 m, set in early December 1997 in Thialf, Heerenveen, where he clocked 1:52.25 to break the record. In Nagano where he finished in 12th position he broke his own world junior record to a new best time of 1:51.47, which was 0.78 of a second faster. He also finished in 29th position at the 5000 m. In November 1998 he broke the junior world record over 500 m into a new time of 36.30 in Calgary and a day later he broke his own 1500 m record again, this time 1:49.71 was his new best time. Due to these records and some other decent results in that same weekend he also broke the junior world record for the small allround classification to 153.689 points. That same season he won the bronze medal at the World Junior Allround Championships and broke another two world records. He set 1:10.87 at the 1000 m in February 1999 and a total of 143.965 points for the sprint classification again in Calgary.

South Korean speed skater

As a senior, during his second Olympic Games, the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City he finished 17th at the 500 m, 12th at the 1000 m and 21st at the 1500 m. He also represented South Korea four years later during the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin. In Italy he finished in his all-time best Olympic result, by becoming 8th at the 500 m. He also became 17th at the 1000 m.

“Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha” is a romantic-comedy Korean drama and an outstanding remake of the 2004 film, “Mr. Hong”.

Since its premiere on August 28, 2021, the show consistently holds the highest nationwide viewership ratings in its time slot across all channels, with Episode 14 achieving the highest record so far of 11.6%, according to Nielsen Korea.

It centers around two opposite lives, Yoon Hye-jin, a perfectionist dentist from the city of Seoul and Chief Hong Dusik, a free-spirited jack-of-all-trades from the countryside. The story progresses as they cross paths and fall in love through inconveniences and adorable bickering.

But there’s more to this romantic show where the writer takes us to the daily life of residents at the seaside village of Gongjin—a place where life is calm and slow-paced but where rich and profound stories abound. And it is no doubt that the entire cast is superb in portraying their characters as nosy yet warmhearted neighbors from the main leads to the supporting roles. Each one stands out.

Here are the 20 stars who made the seaside village of Gongjin more vibrant and engaging:

1. Lee Sang-yi as Ji Seong-hyun

Lee Sang-yi is a 30-year-old singer, part of the supergroup MSG Wannabe, and a cast member of the variety show, “Hangout with Yoo” (2021).

His path to acting career began in 2017 with the series, “Manhole” followed by the following successful projects: Prison Playbook (2017), When the Camellia Blooms (2019), and Youth of May (2021). He also appeared as a cameo role in Yumi’s Cells (2021).

In Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, he portrays the character of Ji Seong-hyun, a workaholic variety show director, and a secret college admirer of Yoon Hye-jin (Shin Min-a). Although he is part of the love triangle between Kim Seonho and Shin Mina in the drama, his role is a non-toxic kind.

While most romantic dramas with love triangles create either an annoying character or a heartbreaking “second lead syndrome”, Lee Sang-yi’s role is not a desperate take. Despite falling depressed for being broken twice, he remains positive with his friendship with Chief Hong and Hye-jin while moving on in life.

In fact, another character is set for his possible happiness—his writer, a long-time staff who cares for him that we hope love will soon develop between the two.

2. Cho Han-cheul as Oh Cheon-jae

Cho Han-cheul is a 48-year-old veteran actor who appeared in numerous films and television series including the hit series, “Vincenzo” (2021). He also worked with Shin Min-a in the series, “Tomorrow with You” in 2017.

2021 is indeed a busy year for the actor since he is also part of the upcoming series, “Jirisan” alongside Jun Ji-hyun (the Sassy Girl), Ju Ji-hoon (the Crown Prince in Kingdom), Oh Jung-se (Sang-tae in IOTNBO), and the nation’s grandmother, Kim Young-ok.

It is also confirmed that he will reunite with Song Joong-ki for another drama, “The Youngest Son of Chaebol Family”.

Known as Oh Cheon-jae or Oh Yoon in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, he plays the role of a cafe owner, widowed with one daughter, and a frustrated singer who reflects a life of broken dreams. He acts as an older brother to Chief Hong (Kim Seonho).

3. Kim Young-ok as Kim Gam-ri

Kim Young-ok is an 84-year-old actress who is also known as “The Nation’s Grandmother” for her several roles as granny in films and dramas, including the famous series “Coffee Prince” (2007), “Boys Over Flowers” (2009), “Her Private Life” (2019), “Love Alarm” (2019), “The King Eternal Monarch” (2020), and “Mouse” (2021).

Aside from her role in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha this year, she also actively participated in the hit series, “Squid Game” and will soon play a part in the upcoming drama, “Jirisan”.

She has received a number of awards including the “Grand Prize Daesang for Television” at the 15th Baeksang Arts Awards and “Lifetime Achievement Award” at the 11th Korea Drama Awards.

Before the premiere of Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she participated as a guest in “2 Days and 1 Night” Season 4, surprising Kim Seonho who is an active cast member of the variety show.

Known as Ms. Kim Gam-ri in the drama, she portrays the character of a grandmother who took care of the young orphan, Hong Dusik (Kim Seonho). She lives a lonely old life whose family is far away, physically and emotionally. Nevertheless, she has Chief Hong who looks after her and loves her.

4. In Gyo-jin as Chang Yeong-guk

In Gyo-jin is a 41-year-old actor who made his acting debut in 2000. He is married to an actress, So Yi-hyun, and has a younger brother who is also an actor, In Doo-jin.

His drama projects include the “Good Doctor” (2013), cameo roles in “Fight For My Way” (2017), “Welcome to Waikiki 2” (2018), and “When the Camellia Blooms” (2019).

He also appeared with his first daughter, Ha-eun as cast members in the famous variety show, “The Return of Superman” in 2016.

In Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, he portrays the role of a Village Chief who is divorced and lives alone. He struggles between his first love and ex-wife.

5. Lee Bong-ryun as Yeo Hwa-jung

Lee Bong-ryun is a 40-year-old actress who began her acting career in stage plays.

In 2013, she joined the television series, “Reply 1994”, followed by other hit series, “While You Were Sleeping” (2017), “Run On” (2020), and “Sweet Home” (2020).

In 2021 Baeksang Arts Awards, she won the “Best Actress” for her role in a theatrical play, “Hamlet”.

She portrays the ex-wife of the Village Chief in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, lives with her smart boy, I-joon, and acts as the reliable leader in town. She also owns the seafood restaurant, the apartment where Yoon Hye-jin (Shin Min-a) lives and the building where Hye-jin sets up her dental clinic.

Her character reflects a fighting spirit amid the uncertainties of life. She knows pain but refuses to face it and moves on in life, as if undisturbed.

6. Cha Chung-hwa as Jo Nam-sook

Cha Chung-hwa is a 41-year-old actress who made her acting debut in a musical stage performance in 2005, followed by a film role in 2010.

Since then, she appeared in several outstanding films and television series, such as “Train to Busan” (2016), “Hotel Del Luna” (2019), “Crash Landing On You” (2020), “Itaewon Class” (2020), “Mr. Queen” (2021), “Beyond Evil” (2021), and “Hospital Playlist 2” (2021).

Known as Nam-sook in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she portrays the role of a lonely mother but bubbly and very nosy neighbor. Being a loud person who meddles in the life of others is her way to conceal and escape the painful void at home.

7. Kang Hyung-suk as Choi Eun-cheol

Kang Hyung-suk is a 29-year-old rookie actor who is handled by the same talent agency with Shin Min-a and Kim Woo-bin, which is the AM Entertainment.

He has participated as a guest or minor role in the following hit dramas, “Crash Landing On You” (2019) and “Itaewon Class” (2020).

In Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, he gets more screen time, portraying the role of a reserved police officer and an innocent lover of a city girl, Pyo Mi-seon.

8. Gong Min-jung as Pyo Mi-seon

Gong Min-jung is a 35-year-old actress who graduated at Konkuk University with a degree on Film. She appeared in several movies since 2011 and started her television debut in 2017.

Some of her works include, “Grass” (2018) which was premiered at the 68th Berlin International Film Festival and “Zombie Crush in Heyri” (2020), premiered in Korean Fantastic Competition of 24th Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival where she had Fantastic Best Actor Special Mention award.

Known as Pyo Mi-seon in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she portrays the ever faithful bestfriend of Shin Min-a and the lover of Choi Eun-chol, the policeman.

9. Lee Yong-Lee as Lee Mat-yi

Lee Yong-Lee is a 63-year-old actress who appeared in several films and television series such as “Uncontrollably Fond” (2016) and “Chief of Staff” (2019), alongside Shin Min-a.

She is the loud one among the trio grandmothers in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha.

10. Shin Shin-ae as Park Sook-ja

Shin Shin-ae is a 62-year-old singer and actress who appeared in various films and television series such as “Extreme Job” (2019) and “Lost” (2021). She is also a regular member of the tv show, “Voice Trot”.

She is the tender one among the trio grandmothers in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha.

11. Kim Ju-yeon as Ham Yun-gyeong

Kim Ju-yeon is a 28-year-old singer and actress who appeared in the series “Dodosolsol Lalasol” (2020), “Move to Heaven” (2021), and “Youth of May” (2021), alongside Lee Sang-yi.

In Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she portrays the role of a store owner with a youthful husband and bubbly daughter. She is also pregnant with her second child.

12. Yoon Seok-hyun as Choi Geum-cheol

Yoon Seok-hyun is a 38-year-old musical actor who appeared in the 2014 film, “Mr. Perfect”.

Known as Cheol in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, he portrays the role of a playful husband whose wife is pregnant and daughter is boyish. He is also a high school classmate of Hong Dusik (Kim Seonho) who saved him from a group of bullies.

13. Hong Ji-hee as Yu Cho-hui

Hong Ji-hee is a 33-year-old actress who appeared in the popular series, “Arthdal Chronicles” (2019) and “Hospital Playlist” (2020).

In Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she portrays the role of an old friend who went back in Gongjin to start anew as a classroom teacher where she gets trapped between the ex-couple, Yeo Hwa-jung and Chang Yeong-guk.

14. Park Ye-young as Wang Ji-won

Park Ye-young is a 32-year-old actress who appeared in various films and television series. She played the main roles of the movies, “The Road Not Taken” (2016) and “Capsule Coffee” (2018).

Known as Writer Wang in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she has a hidden admiration for her long-time co-worker, Director Ji Seong-hyun (Lee Sang-yi).

15. Byun Seong Tae as June

Byun Seong Tae is a 23-year-old rookie actor who participated as a cameo role in the series, “Nevertheless” (2021). He also appeared as a contestant in a talent show, “Produce 101”.

Known as June in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, he is a member of a fictional famous boy band, DOS, who comes to Gongjin to perform in a festival and shoot for a variety show alongside Director Ji.

16. Kim Min-seo as Oh Juri

Kim Min-seo is a 12-year-old child actress who appeared in various films and television series since she was nine. She is a huge fan of the singer-actress, IU, and also a cast member of ODG, a popular YouTube channel.

Known as Juri in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, she is the loud yet beloved daughter of cafe owner, Oh Chun-jae, and a diehard fan of June.

17. Ki Eun-yoo as Chang I-jun

Ki Eun-yoo is an 8-year-old child actor who already appeared in various television series such as the “Mystic Pop-up Bar” (2020), “Do You Like Brahms?” (2020), “18 Again” (2020), and “The Devil Judge” (2021).

He is the gentle and genius son of the ex-couple, Yeo Hwa-jung and Chang Yeong-guk, in Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha. He also has a bestfriend named Bo-ra, the boyish daughter of the store owners, Choi Geum-cheol and Ham Yun-gyeong.

18. Ko Do-yeon as Choi Bo-ra

Ko Do-yeon is a 9-year-old child actress who appeared in the famous series, “It’s Okay To Not Be Okay” (2020) and “Hospital Playlist” (2020.

She is the adorable daughter of the store owners, Choi Geum-cheol and Ham Yun-gyeong, and bestfriend of jan Yi-joon. In Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha’s Lighthouse Music Festival singing contest, she won first place.

19. Shin Min-a as Doctor Yoon Hye-jin

Shin Min-a, the lead female star of Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, is a 37-year-old award-winning model and actress who has been in the industry for more than 20 years now. It is reported that she is one of the most in-demand and highest paid commercial endorsers in South Korea.

Aside from modelling and acting, she can also sing and has participated as a vocalist in several singles and soundtracks.

Know more about her works and awards here.

20. Kim Seonho as Chief Hong Dusik

Kim Seonho, the lead actor of Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha, is a 35-year-old actor who rose to fame with his character “Han Jipyeong”, a secondary role, through the drama, Start-Up, in 2020. Since then, he has received numerous commercial and project offers while his Instagram followers exceptionally increased from hundreds to millions in just a few weeks.

His love for acting started in college when he joined a theater group at Seoul Institute of the Arts. He then worked as a stage play actor for seven years (2009-2016).

He made his television debut in the drama, “Good Manager” (2017) followed by “Strongest Deliveryman” (2017), “Two Cops” (2018), “You Drive Me Crazy” (2018), “100 Days My Prince”(2018), “Welcome to Waikiki 2” (2019), “Catch the Ghost” (2019), and “Start-up” (2020).

“Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha” (2021) is his first main role project as an actor. Recently, it was reported that Kim Seonho will appear for the first time on the big screen next year. Know more about his 2022 film projects and roles here.

Aside from acting, he is also an active cast member of the popular variety show, “2 Days and 1 Night” Season 4.

Sharon Choi, Bong Joon-ho's translator, receives major award

Bong Joon-ho's translator, who became an instant global sensation when the director of "Parasite" won the Academy Award earlier this year, received the YoungSan Diplomat Award on Wednesday for her role in enhancing Korea's international image.Choi Sung-jae, better known as Sharon Choi, is not a professional translator, but she charmed audiences with her precise yet witty interpretations that managed to convey the ideas and capture the character of the enigmatic Bong.Clips of Choi's online interview with Canadian-American actor Sandra Oh on the subject of BBC drama series "Killing Eve" became a viral hit recently for her insightful questions not only about the story but also social issues. The interview, supposed to go for 15 minutes, was extended to 40 minutes.The YoungSan Diplomat Award is annually presented by the Seoul Forum for International Affairs to recognize a public official and a civilian for their contributions to Korea's image and the country's diplomatic interests.According to Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Choi and Kang Hyung-sik, the head of foreign ministry's international safety management bureau, are the winners of the 12th YoungSan Diplomat Award. Kang, also known as the "Invisible hand" for managing the country's responses to global incidents and recently to the coronavirus pandemic, was recognized for having contributed greatly to the repatriation of Korean citizens stuck abroad.Foreign Minister Kang Kyung-hwa will attend the ceremony and congratulate the recipients.BY LEE JAE-LIM [lee.jaelim@joongang.co.kr]

Jun Ji-hyun (b. October 30, 1981) first became well-known as a commercial model and as a TV actress. Although she made her film debut in the little-watched White Valentine in 1999, it was not until later in the year when she was featured in an advertisement for an audio system that she became a popular sensation. The dancing and attitude expressed in the ad made her into an icon for Koreans in their late teens and early twenties.



After continuing her TV and modelling career, Jun made her first well-publicized film appearance in late 2000 with Il Mare. A handsomely-shot melodrama set on Kanghwa Island, the film did respectably well at the box office (despite opening on the same day as Joint Security Area/JSA) and solidified her status as a star.



Jun's breakout film was comedy My Sassy Girl, which became a huge hit both in Korea and throughout Asia with its tale of a gullible college student and his slightly unhinged girlfriend. The film spent two weeks at #1 in Hong Kong, and turned her into Korea's most recognizable star in the Chinese-language market. Two years then passed before she appeared in her next film, an "occult thriller" titled The Uninvited which wowed critics but failed to catch on with viewers. Throughout this time she was a constant presence in TV ads and on billboards in Korea and also in other Asian countries.



2004 saw her return to the big screen in another film by Kwak Jae-yong, the director of My Sassy Girl. Windstruck cast her in the role of a policewoman, but many viewers felt it was too similar to My Sassy Girl. There were also signs that her popularity had started to suffer because of overexposure in advertisements. Nonetheless, Windstruck became the best-performing film ever in Japan, where My Sassy Girl was not as well known.



Jun's next project Daisy teamed her with Jung Woo-sung (who frequently appears together with her in advertisements), and drew attention for its 100% location shooting in the Netherlands, and for using the Hong Kong director Andrew Lau (Infernal Affairs). Nonetheless the film disappointed at the box-office and drew weak appraisals from viewers.



In late 2006 it was announced the Jun would be making her long-predicted jump to Hollywood to take the lead role in Blood: The Last Vampire. The international co-production is the live-action adaptation of a popular Japanese anime.

Let’s meet the cast of Netflix’s latest South Korean drama series, Racket Boys; age, previous roles and ‘how to follow’ on Instagram explained!

At the time of writing, three brilliant Korean dramas are releasing new episodes each week; Law School, Mine and Mad for Each Other.

However, a brand new K-drama is set to premiere this week, Racket Boys. The series tells the story of a middle school badminton team and is sure to become a fan favourite over the course of its 16-episode run.

So, let’s meet the cast of Racket Boys!

Racket Boys: Cast

Kim Sang-kyung as Yoon Hyeon-jong

Kim Sang-kyung is a well-known South Korean actor from Seoul, who fans may recognise from Memories of Murder (2003) and May 18 (2007).

The 48-year-old has appeared in countless television series and films, including The Crown Clown (2019), The 12th Suspect (2019), What Happens to My Family? (2014) and The Great King, Sejong (2008).

Sang-kyung’s birthday is actually on June 1st, so you can celebrate the actor turning 49 with watching the second episode of Racket Boys on Netflix!

Photo by Han Myung-Gu/WireImage

Tang Joon-sang as Yoon Hae-kang

Tang Joon-Sang is a South Korean-Malaysia actor that has become one of the breakout stars of Netflix’s deal with Korean broadcast stations, most noticeably in Crash Landing on You (2019) and Move to Heaven (2021).

Joon-sang was born in Seoul to a Malaysian father of Chinese descent and a South Korean mother, making his professional acting debut in 2010 at the age of just seven years old.

The rising star is currently 17-years-old and has appeared in 10 major television and film projects so far, including The King’s Letters (2019), A Poem a Day (2018) and Single-minded Dandelion (2014).

You can follow him on Twitter @ jamestang0813 and on Instagram @ t_js0813/.

Son Sang-yeon as Bang Yoon-dam

Son Sang-yeon, also known as Son Sang Yun, is another rising South Korean actor.

The 19-year-old may have only made his acting debut in 2016, but he certainly has made his presence known in the world of Korean dramas.

Sang-yeon has played a main role in two hit series so far, Falling in Love (2019) and Triple Fling (2019). However, he has also appeared as a guest/supporting role in various dramas, including Dr Romantic 2 (2020), Level Up (2019), Two Cops (2017), Return of Fortunate Bok (2017) and First Love Again (2016).

At the time of writing, we have been unable to identify an official Instagram and Twitter page.

Photo by ilgan Sports/Multi-Bits via Getty Images

Oh Na-ra as Ra Yeong-ja

Oh Na-ra is a South Korean actress and is arguably the most recognisable cast member from Racket Boys.

The 46-year-old veteran of both the small and big screen has appeared a variety of fan favourite projects, including Chip In (2020), Sky Castle (2018), My Mister (2018), Because I Love You (2017) and Dancing Queen (2012).

Fans may also recognise her from her performances in Yong-pal (2015), Hyde Jekyll, Me (2015), Flowers of the Prison (2016) and The Lady in Dignity (2017).

You can follow her on Instagram @ sabita_5.

Choi Hyun-wook as Na Woo-chan

Choi Hyun-wook is a 19-year-old South Korean actor who is making his first appearance in a major series as a main character.

The young actor was the star of vLive’s fan favourite series ‘Real:Time:Love’ which ran for four mini-seasons in 2019.

Hyun-wook also appeared in two episodes of the recently concluded drama ‘Taxi Driver’.

You can follow him on Instagram @ _choiiii__.

Kim Kang-hoon as Lee Yong-tae

Kim Kang-hoon is arguably the best child actor currently working in South Korea’s intense entertainment industry.

At the time of writing, the actor is only 11-years-old, but this has not stopped him from appearing in an impressive list of movies and television series.

Fans may recognise Kang-hoon from Mr. Queen (2021), Start-Up (2020), 18 Again (2020), Kingdom (2020), Hotel Del Luna (2019), When the Camellia Blooms (2019) and Mr. Sunshine (2018).

You can follow him on Instagram @ kanghoon.juwon.

Let’s meet the cast of Netflix’s latest South Korean drama series, Racket Boys; age, previous roles and ‘how to follow’ on Instagram explained!

At the time of writing, three brilliant Korean dramas are releasing new episodes each week; Law School, Mine and Mad for Each Other.

However, a brand new K-drama is set to premiere this week, Racket Boys. The series tells the story of a middle school badminton team and is sure to become a fan favourite over the course of its 16-episode run.

So, let’s meet the cast of Racket Boys!

Racket Boys: Cast

Kim Sang-kyung as Yoon Hyeon-jong

Kim Sang-kyung is a well-known South Korean actor from Seoul, who fans may recognise from Memories of Murder (2003) and May 18 (2007).

The 48-year-old has appeared in countless television series and films, including The Crown Clown (2019), The 12th Suspect (2019), What Happens to My Family? (2014) and The Great King, Sejong (2008).

Sang-kyung’s birthday is actually on June 1st, so you can celebrate the actor turning 49 with watching the second episode of Racket Boys on Netflix!

Photo by Han Myung-Gu/WireImage

Tang Joon-sang as Yoon Hae-kang

Tang Joon-Sang is a South Korean-Malaysia actor that has become one of the breakout stars of Netflix’s deal with Korean broadcast stations, most noticeably in Crash Landing on You (2019) and Move to Heaven (2021).

Joon-sang was born in Seoul to a Malaysian father of Chinese descent and a South Korean mother, making his professional acting debut in 2010 at the age of just seven years old.

The rising star is currently 17-years-old and has appeared in 10 major television and film projects so far, including The King’s Letters (2019), A Poem a Day (2018) and Single-minded Dandelion (2014).

You can follow him on Twitter @ jamestang0813 and on Instagram @ t_js0813/.

Son Sang-yeon as Bang Yoon-dam

Son Sang-yeon, also known as Son Sang Yun, is another rising South Korean actor.

The 19-year-old may have only made his acting debut in 2016, but he certainly has made his presence known in the world of Korean dramas.

Sang-yeon has played a main role in two hit series so far, Falling in Love (2019) and Triple Fling (2019). However, he has also appeared as a guest/supporting role in various dramas, including Dr Romantic 2 (2020), Level Up (2019), Two Cops (2017), Return of Fortunate Bok (2017) and First Love Again (2016).

At the time of writing, we have been unable to identify an official Instagram and Twitter page.

Photo by ilgan Sports/Multi-Bits via Getty Images

Oh Na-ra as Ra Yeong-ja

Oh Na-ra is a South Korean actress and is arguably the most recognisable cast member from Racket Boys.

The 46-year-old veteran of both the small and big screen has appeared a variety of fan favourite projects, including Chip In (2020), Sky Castle (2018), My Mister (2018), Because I Love You (2017) and Dancing Queen (2012).

Fans may also recognise her from her performances in Yong-pal (2015), Hyde Jekyll, Me (2015), Flowers of the Prison (2016) and The Lady in Dignity (2017).

You can follow her on Instagram @ sabita_5.

Choi Hyun-wook as Na Woo-chan

Choi Hyun-wook is a 19-year-old South Korean actor who is making his first appearance in a major series as a main character.

The young actor was the star of vLive’s fan favourite series ‘Real:Time:Love’ which ran for four mini-seasons in 2019.

Hyun-wook also appeared in two episodes of the recently concluded drama ‘Taxi Driver’.

You can follow him on Instagram @ _choiiii__.

Kim Kang-hoon as Lee Yong-tae

Kim Kang-hoon is arguably the best child actor currently working in South Korea’s intense entertainment industry.

At the time of writing, the actor is only 11-years-old, but this has not stopped him from appearing in an impressive list of movies and television series.

Fans may recognise Kang-hoon from Mr. Queen (2021), Start-Up (2020), 18 Again (2020), Kingdom (2020), Hotel Del Luna (2019), When the Camellia Blooms (2019) and Mr. Sunshine (2018).

You can follow him on Instagram @ kanghoon.juwon.

Choi Jae-bong (Korean: 최재봉, Hanja: 崔財鳳, born 19 June 1980) is a South Korean speed skater. He represented his country at the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano. At that time he was the holder of the junior World record at 1500 m, set in early December 1997 in Thialf, Heerenveen, where he clocked 1:52.25 to break the record. In Nagano where he finished in 12th position he broke his own world junior record to a new best time of 1:51.47, which was 0.78 of a second faster. He also finished in 29th position at the 5000 m. In November 1998 he broke the junior world record over 500 m into a new time of 36.30 in Calgary and a day later he broke his own 1500 m record again, this time 1:49.71 was his new best time. Due to these records and some other decent results in that same weekend he also broke the junior world record for the small allround classification to 153.689 points. That same season he won the bronze medal at the World Junior Allround Championships and broke another two world records. He set 1:10.87 at the 1000 m in February 1999 and a total of 143.965 points for the sprint classification again in Calgary.

South Korean speed skater

Quick facts: Personal information, Born, Height, Weight, S... ▼

As a senior, during his second Olympic Games, the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City he finished 17th at the 500 m, 12th at the 1000 m and 21st at the 1500 m. He also represented South Korea four years later during the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin. In Italy he finished in his all-time best Olympic result, by becoming 8th at the 500 m. He also became 17th at the 1000 m.

TvN‘s K-Drama Crash Course in Romance has become a hit worldwide as viewers have fallen in love with the star math teacher Choi Chi Yeol (played by Jung Kyung Ho) and shop owner Nam Haeng Seon (Jeon Do Yeon), who have fallen for each other.

Yet, the cast have their real-life romances… just not with each other! So, who are they dating in real life?

All the young actors, such as Roh Yoon Seo, Lee Chae Min, Lee Min Jae, and Shin Jae Ha, are not publicly dating anyone at this time, which is not too surprising, especially for Roh, since she’s still considered a rookie actress. Yet, even 39-year-old actor Oh Eui Shik‘s relationship status is unknown.

On the other hand, 42-year-old actress Lee Bong Ryun, who portrays Nam Haeng Seon’s bestie, married fellow actor Lee Gyu Hee on March 11, 2019. They met as schoolmates at Alleyway Theater Company.

While Lee Gyu Hee might not be as recognizable as his wife, he has appeared in some of our favorite K-Dramas, including Crash Landing on You, Beyond Evil, and Reborn Rich. He has also appeared in stage productions, such as Beautiful Food, Passing Summer, and Potato Symphony.

Jeon Do Yeon is actually 50 years old in real life, so she’s older than her character. Considering this, it should be no surprise that she is not dating but is actually already married!

The veteran actress is married to professional car racer and businessman Kang Shi Kyu, but he’s not a known celebrity. He is nine years her senior.

The couple married in a private ceremony at the Shilla Hotel in Seoul on March 11, 2007, so their 16th wedding anniversary is coming up! Their daughter was born a couple of years later, on January 22, 2009.

Jung Kyung Ho has been in a relationship with fellow actor Girls’ Generation‘s Sooyoung since January 2014 after originally denying rumors in 2013 since they were just getting to know each other at the time. A “mutual acquaintance” introduced him to her, and he admitted that despite her being his ideal type, “I didn’t straight up ask to be set up with her, but I did have my intentions when I first met her.”

Because we have been dating for so long, I’m much more comfortable with it (being asked about his girlfriend). Rather than worry about what others think, (we) focus on things that make us happy. We’ve become much more flexible with one another. — Jung Kyung Ho

So, they have been together for at least a decade, and this power couple is still going strong, too, as they were recently spotted on a date! Sooyoung actually liked a picture from it from her personal Instagram account.

Jung Kyung Ho has spoken about his relationship in interviews. Considering he and Sooyoung have been together for so long, naturally, everyone is curious about when they’ll get married. Previously, he said they would surely get married, but only time would tell.

I’m sure we will (get married) when the time is right. — Jung Kyung Ho

Crash Course in Romance even contained an unexpected reference to Sooyoung. Did you catch it? Read more below.
